<[silence:3600]>

The word "car" traces back to the Latin "carrus"<[silence:250]> meaning a two-wheeled Celtic war chariot<[silence:1200]>
By the fourteenth century<[silence:250]> it evolved in Middle English as "carre"<[silence:250]> denoting a wheeled vehicle<[silence:1200]>
Modern usage<[silence:250]> solidified in the nineteenth century with the advent of motorized automobiles<[silence:3600]>

Three related concepts are chariot<[silence:250]> automobile<[silence:250]> and locomotion.
